page.title: 03LIMBURY AND THE MOAT HOUSE
page.content: Limbury is primarily residential,most houses being built between 1959 and 1975.34% of land cover is open space and a lot of this is{River Side walk,which has been extended to create a pleasant walk along the{River Lea} which flows from West to South-East before turning South to London.The one building of real historical interest is the Moat House,which was built between 1370 and 1400 as a{Norman} {Manor House.}The{Timber}roofing has been preserved,despite a fire in 1967,and there is an inscription dated 1666 describing hailstones the size of golfballs.Now used as a{Restaurant,} the building is still surrounded by a{ {moat},hence the name.On the north side of the River Lea close to the Moat House is one of Luton's largest areas of public allotments,and tenancy of these gardens is jealously guarded.
